MajorClaims.MC1: children should be taught co-operation complimented with a healthy competition

Claims.C2: co-operation helps to understand other's perspective and learn by their mistakes
Claims.C3: Competition helps in improvement and evolution
Claims.C4: Competition should be always based on self-improvement rule

Premises.P1: Educational systems emphasize on encouraging co-operative approach in children
Premises.P2: We live in a social setup and mutual help and sharing only leads to success
Premises.P3: A person can not learn or achieve everything by oneself
Premises.P5: It is only due to their teamwork that they are able to catch a prey and make task easy
Premises.P6: co-operative approach will save time, energy and will have a higher success rate
Premises.P7: It helps to identify one's strengths and weaknesses as compared to others
Premises.P8: A co-operative approach can create inspirational and motivational feeling seeing other people's achievements
Premises.P9: competition is also as important as co-operation
Premises.P10: An individual must compete with oneself only, instead of trying to beat others
Premises.P11: Competition has helped the development of science and technology
Premises.P12: every other day, new cars are developed by companies which are more efficient than others
Premises.P13: This kind of competition gives customers more options
Premises.P14: blind and selfish competition is detrimental
Premises.P15: 'Your loss, my gain' kind of competition can never be fruitful in the long run
Premises.P16: A healthy competition which involves raising one's own level above others is the best approach
